result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marco A Quiroz

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation.  Received and Filed.  nk

Adjustment Number: 22A 093479,
Payable Number: 1036196,
Receipt Number: 22RP039528,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Marco A Quiroz in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Marco A Quiroz.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant has retain Attorney Birdsall as counsel. Notice of retainer has not been filed at this time. Defense requests a status of conference date. State does not object. Court grants requests and authorized that the parties can appear by zoom on the next scheduled court date. Defendant must appear in person. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marco A Quiroz in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Alexander James Geocaris for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested adjournment due to defendant retaining private counsel; Attorney John A. Birdsall.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marco A Quiroz in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Birdsall appeared by telephone as potential new counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Marco A Quiroz in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Marco A Quiroz in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Jason Findling contacted the court with a pre-arranged adjourned date. Case is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marco A Quiroz in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defense counsel is unavailable, out of the country. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Change of court date to time. Original date 05/26/22 @0830. New court date set  06/23/22 @0830

Defendant Marco A Quiroz not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Marco A Quiroz in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Marco A Quiroz in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marco A Quiroz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
